intro: Ardisia retroflexa, commonly known as the redroot evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and the coastal areas of the Gulf of Mexico. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer. Its berries, which turn bright red when mature, are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia retroflexa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to different soil types.
